source.author: Barker, W.R.
source.title: Scrophulariaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Barker, W.R. (1999). Scrophulariaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Flowers 2 or 3 in bract axils (single and often with a bud in young racemes); pedicels and sepals more or less glabrous, pedicels 2–5 (–10) mm long; corolla 4–7 mm long along the upper side
Flowers single in bract axils; pedicels and sepals minutely glandular hairy; pedicels 8–25 mm long; corolla 6–12 mm long along the upper side
